Operations Performed

  • Repair initial inguinal hernia, age 5 years or older; reducible (49505)

Surgeon

  • General Surgery, MD

Assistants

  • Pain Management,

Date of surgery

  • Tuesday, June 25, 2013

Preoperative Diagnosis

  • Inguinal hernia without mention of obstruction or gangrene, unilateral or unspecified, (not specified as recurrent) (550.90)

Postoperative Diagnosis

  • Inguinal hernia without mention of obstruction or gangrene, unilateral or unspecified, (not specified as recurrent) (550.90)

Indications for Surgery

Indications

  • Pain
  • Discomfort
  • Enlarging mass

Risk and Consent

Risk Factors

  • Increased body mass index

ASA Physical Status

  • Class II. Patient with mild systemic disease

Informed Consent

  • Yes: Indications for surgical procedure, risks, benefits, possible complications explained to patient including alternatives in treatment. Patient had the chance to ask questions and all were answered to their satisfaction. Patient understood and gave consent.

Operative Findings

Operative Findings

  • Indirect hernia

Preparation

Anesthesia

  • Local

Position

  • Supine

Surgical Field

  • Clipped
  • Antiseptic applied
  • Betadine

Draping

  • Appropriate draping

Pre-medication

  • Antibiotic administered within one hour of surgical incision

Operative Description

Repair initial inguinal hernia, age 5 years or older; reducible (49505)

Laterality

  • Left

Operation Description

  • Incision was made and carried down to the external oblique fascia
  • Fascia was incised in the direction of its fibers to to external inguinal ring
  • Cord was mobilized and encircled
  • Nerves were carefully preserved
  • Vas deferens and vessels carefully preserved intact
  • Hernia sac exposed, adequately visualized and identified
  • Sac carefully dissected from surrounding structures
  • Sac ligated and redundant portion excised
  • Hernia sac and contents reduced
  • Marlex mesh plug and patch applied
  • Hemostasis assured
  • Wound irrigated
  • Incision closed in layers
  • Appropriate dressing applied

Discharge and Condition

Estimated blood loss

  • 25 mL or less

Sponge/needle/instrument count

  • Correct x 2

Discharge

  • Surgical day care recovery

Condition

  • Stable

DVT Prophylaxis

  • Anti Embolism Stockings (TED Stockings)

Specimen

  • Sac sent to pathology

Complications

  • No complications

Comments

  • Patient tolerated procedure well. Follow up in 2 weeks.

Signature

  • Signed by General Surgery, MD at 1:37 PM Tuesday, June 25, 2013
